summary: This is a chain of emails from August 2019 discussing legal strategy in the Florida CVRA case, focusing on the scope of Jeffrey Epstein's 2008 Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA). The emails highlight a key 2008 court concession by Epstein's attorney that the NPA only applied to the Southern District of Florida, and discuss recent filings by victims' counsel arguing the NPA does not extend to New York.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Epstein's attorney who, during a 2008 Florida state court hearing where Epstein pled guilty, stated on Epstein's behalf that the NPA contained an obligation by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida not to prosecute Epstein in that district.

persons.name: Marty Weinberg
persons.context: Epstein's lawyer who filed a motion for a sur-reply in the Florida CVRA case in July 2019, arguing for an opportunity to discuss the scope of the NPA.

persons.name: Judge Marra
persons.context: The judge presiding over the Florida CVRA case, who is poised to rule on motions and was asked to craft remedies relating solely to Florida crimes and victims.

persons.name: Jane Doe 1
persons.context: A victim/plaintiff in the Florida CVRA case. Counsel represents her and another victim, Jane Doe 2.

persons.name: Jane Doe 2
persons.context: A victim/plaintiff in the Florida CVRA case, referenced alongside Jane Doe 1.

connections.description: Goldberger represented Epstein in the 2008 Florida state court proceedings where Epstein pled guilty.
Weinberg represented Epstein in the 2019 Florida CVRA proceedings, filing motions on his behalf.
Both are victims/plaintiffs represented by the same counsel in the Florida CVRA case.

events.title: Epstein's Florida Guilty Plea Hearing
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pled guilty to Florida state charges. During questioning by the judge, his attorney Jack Goldberger stated the NPA obligated the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida not to prosecute Epstein in that district.

events.title: Filing of Reply Brief on Remedies in CVRA Case
events.description: Counsel for Jane Doe 1 and 2 filed a reply brief on remedies in the Florida CVRA case, arguing Judge Marra must craft remedies solely for Florida crimes/victims because the NPA only covers Florida.

events.title: Weinberg Files Motion for Sur-Reply
events.description: Epstein's lawyer Marty Weinberg filed a motion for a sur-reply in the CVRA case, seeking to discuss the scope of the NPA.

keyFacts: During Epstein's 2008 guilty plea hearing, his attorney Jack Goldberger explicitly stated the Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) only obligated the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida not to prosecute Epstein in that specific district.

In 2019, victims' counsel in the CVRA case argued to Judge Marra that remedies must relate solely to Florida crimes and victims because the NPA's scope was limited to Florida, and did not extend to New York.
Epstein's 2019 attorney, Marty Weinberg, sought to file a sur-reply to argue about the scope of the NPA, indicating the geographical limitation of the NPA was a contested and pivotal legal issue.
The email chain shows ongoing legal coordination and information sharing in 2019 regarding the interpretation and territorial scope of the 2008 NPA.
